subject: Implement VPD recollection
commitMessage:
Implement VPD recollection

This commit implements functionality to recollect VPD for a hardware
by triggering VPD parser for that hardware in case there is a
replacement.

Signed-off-by: Sunny Srivastava <sunnsr25@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ia0d377b554299faac3b46a4dc8dd96f964f07bd2

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 9a19554c7e10639be9f6d7b6077823148088b273 by Santosh Puranik
as you have added namespace in line no 14, remove all these std.

Changing the portion of code out of the scope of this commit can be taken as some code refactoring in future as there is no point including all those changes in this commit.
We can though take care of this in and post this commit for this file.
Done
this can be-  if ( ! singleFru.value("devTreeStatus", true) )
Done
I think you can go with just else instead of else if.
Done
you can remove std , all occurrence
Done

please hi-light your change here.
you can add comment there, saying- this is my change.
why this new line?
Yes, I placed it here so that if/else can be spaced out from the object creation and filling the parse result.
I don't see cmd output parameter
Ack
can you specify which command?

There is no specific command that this api will execute, it can take different command strings and will execute that. So it won't be possible to specify the command here.
Let me know if that makes sense.
what kind of commands it is? kernel commands ? am just asking the generic term of it instead of "that" command
Ack

why we have this check at the beggining of the loop? for the first time entry into the loop, isRecollected is anyways false..
Can we have this as else case in line 258.. you are checking the same condition there as well.

1) How do you ensure that when is the first entry to the loop? We are not maintaining any counter here.
2) There is array of inventory under an EEPROM path, so once data has been recollected for any of the FRU under that EEPROM path we do not want recollection to trigger again for other FRUs in the array.
So I am checking before processing the FRU here at the beginning to check if the data has been recollected.
3) Check at line 258 is to handle the case where the fields required for recollection is missing and the loop gets exhausted.

I did not understand the "Can we have this as else..." part though. Else of which if?

ok..ignore the previous comment.. I have another thought on this to avoid this if (isRecollected){ break; } at line 180..
put a break statement whenever isRecollected is set to true - that is at line 227 & 245.. so that it breaks the inner loop once the recollection is successful..
you don't want a check for this..
Ack

Should we have AND && condition here instead of OR ||?

Coz, in line 197-199 , you are assigning values of all three properties(devAddress, driverType, busType).. so looks the three properties together are mandatory.. 
so we will use && while checking the presence of three properties.
Yes all these three properties are mandatory that is why OR is being used to check if any one of the property is missing we continue back and do not proceed with recollection.
Got it
Done
is the comment placed in the right line?
Yes, i have placed it intentionally here so that we know why we are continuing and not proceeding with the execution.

oh ok..I get that now.. may be you can rephrase like
" continue looking for these entry in any of the FRU under this EEPROM path "
Done
instead of using this flag, can you tell which flag.
Done
Can we have a fullstop after device tree for readability.
Done
You are checking whether the deviceAddress is in right pattern or not.. Why not using a regex pattern to check it properly ?
No, I am just checking for the position of (-). No Pattern checking. Just for finding one char, I find this convenient.

I can see you throwing the exception when the format of device address is incorrect.. How did you tell the format is incorrect just if '-' is not present in it...why not we have some alphabets in the device address..

I know those cases are not going to happen as the json is build time and we should be responsible for feeding the right value in json.
then why we have to check for '-' alone 😊 

Now I don't find a necessity for the device address format check at line 208.

It is not a format check for device address, Obviously it is build time entry so we do not need to necessarily do that.
Now, since I need the data after "-" as you see in line 217. I am extracting the position of "-" in device address.
Now as a part of practise where after extracting position we check it for end of string i am doing this check which in case fails, I am throwing the exception.

Can we have a seperate variable for this,
string device = str + deviceAddress + " > /sys/bus/" + busType + "/drivers/" + driverType;
as you repeat the same pattern in line 210 and line 239..
then append "/unbind" at the end.. this avoids redundant code.
Done
Can you specify which field is missing in json & if possible can you specify a detailed description of the error

Three fields are required for recollection, now to mention which one is missing I will have to carry a variable which will hold that info and then pass it here. Also I will have to implement different individual checks for each field and create a dynamic string here.
Doing all that to add just the filed info out of just three to exception does not appear to add much value.

Also which extra info you think would be helpful here about the exception?
Please let me know if you agree.

Extra Info is describing the scenario like: "when you are trying to do recollection for "this" particular fru (mention the fru path), found "this" field is missing" 
it will more clear and debugging is made simpler with the exception message itself.

even for those who are not knowledged on the vpd-code, they be able to understand the error easily..
Ack
two times "to"
Done

Why we have this json here?
if we have to maintain the json in the repo, json should go into
openpower-vpd-parser/system/json/ directory..

This is just for review purpose as there are few fields that i have added under ebmc_card.
Also I do not see and system path under openpower-vpd-parser.
Will need some more input on this.
if its just for this commit purpose, then fine..

This cannot be str + "/bind" now.. as value of str = "echo"..
Thats why I asked you to have
string device = str + deviceAddress + " > /sys/bus/" + busType + "/drivers/" + driverType;
Then append unbind/bind wherever you want to..
Ahh, missed that. Thanks.
Please move this inline too

Nit: implements

This commit does not really check for standby state, though. You should reword this to say it provides an implementation for the recollectAPI. The fact that it is called at standby is a systemd service level detail
Done
Done
const string&, else this still ends up creating a copy
Done
This should be rephrased - It does not actually check if anything was replaced at standby - It is simply retrigerring collection for FRUs that *can* be replaced at standby

Please remove at standby from here too - How about:
Implement VPD Recollection
Done
